I set a break point on the line that is failing, and each time I got to that line the element was an Interface (e.g. Constants.class)
The version that I was using was JEM-SDK-1.2M3, but I have been seeing these errors for a while now.

Created an attachment (id=41493)
patch to prevent NPE

What line in getFullnameFromElement was actually throwing the NPE? The trace doesn't give the line number. There shouldn't be any nulls and I need to find out why.

The patch seems to indicate it is getting the logger. Are you running outside of Eclipse? If you are running inside of eclipse there should always be a JavaPlugin.
It's an "I'm an idiot!" problem. When converting from Eclipse 3.0 style plugin to 3.2 style I forgot to initialize a variable.
There is an additional and even worse bug. When the project is closed or deleted the resource change listener IS NOT removed and hangs around.
The fix has been released to HEAD. It will be JEM 1.2RC1 which is due out May 19.

(In reply to comment #6)
The variable is being initialized in the constructor, so I think the root problem is that the plug-in does not get automatically activated when a class is loaded. 

I don't think the fix (of initializing the INSTANCE variable in the startBundle method) will work either, for the same reason, the plug-in isn't activated so the method is never called.

From a performance point of view I'm not sure that activativing the plug-in is the right fix, it may be better just to assume that the plug-in might not be activated and write code that is more defensive.
VE 1.2RC1 is out, so these can now be closed.
